title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: dat.atelectasis <- escalc(measure="RR",               ai=c( 3,  2,  1,  1,  0),               bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),               ci=c( 4,  6,  4,  2,  1),               di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),               slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",                      "Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021")               )

what: Primary analysis: Paul-Mandel without Hartung-Knapp-Sidik-Jonkman (HKSJ) modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: results agree paper (Fig 2, bottom).
code: pm <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM")  forest(pm,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: Note: standard RE model without HKSJ modification identical (shown):
code: fe <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="FE")  forest(fe,         atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10))) re <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="REML")

what: Sensitivity analysis 2: Paule-Mandel with HKSJ modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: pmhk <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM", test="knha")  forest(pmhk,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

what: Sensitivity analysis 3: Odds ratios (Paule-Mandel without HKSJ modification)
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: Results similar primary analysis results.
code: dat.atelectasis.OR <- escalc(measure="OR",               ai=c(3, 2, 1, 1, 0),               bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),               ci=c(4, 6, 4, 2, 1),               di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),               slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",                      "Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021")               ) pm.OR <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis.OR, method="PM")  forest(pm.OR,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: Results almost identical results paper (difference 0.01 upper confidence interval Mahmoud et al.).
code: leave1.atel <- leave1out(pm) forest.default(x=leave1.atel$estimate, ci.lb=leave1.atel$ci.lb, ci.ub=leave1.atel$ci.ub,                slab=paste("Omitting ", leave1.atel$slab, sep=""),atransf=exp,                at=log(c(0.15, 0.25, exp(pm$b), 1, 4)), xlim=log(c(0.01, 4.5)),                refline=pm$b               ) lines(x=log(c(1, 1)), y=c(0, 6))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: funnel(pm, main="Standard Error") regtest(pm) #>  #> Regression Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry #>  #> Model:     mixed-effects meta-regression model #> Predictor: standard error #>  #> Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry: z = -0.5600, p = 0.5755 #> Limit Estimate (as sei -> 0):   b = 0.0184 (CI: -2.8837, 2.9205)

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: dat <- escalc(measure="RR",               ai=c(3,   5,  2,  0,  1),               bi=c(32, 39, 43, 15, 24),               ci=c(6,   7,  4,  1,  2),               di=c(29, 35, 41, 14, 23),               slab=c("Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021",                      "Yao et al, 2020"))

what: Primary analysis: Paul-Mandel without Hartung-Knapp-Sidik-Jonkman (HKSJ) modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: results agree paper (Fig 2, top).
code: pm <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="PM")  forest(pm,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: Note: standard RE model without HKSJ modification identical (shown):
code: fe <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="FE")  forest(fe,         atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10))) re <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="REML")

what: Sensitivity analysis 2: Paule-Mandel with HKSJ modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: pmhk <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="PM", test="knha")  forest(pmhk,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

what: Sensitivity analysis 3: Odds ratios (Paule-Mandel without HKSJ modification)
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: Results similar:
code: dat.OR <- escalc(measure="OR",               ai=c(3,   5,  2,  0,  1),               bi=c(32, 39, 43, 15, 24),               ci=c( 6,  7,  4,  1,  2),               di=c(29, 35, 41, 14, 23),               slab=c("Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021",                      "Yao et al, 2020")) pm.OR <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.OR, method="PM")  forest(pm.OR,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: results leave-one-sensitivity analysis agree paper (page 20, bottom, different order)
code: leave1 <- leave1out(pm) forest.default(x=leave1$estimate, ci.lb=leave1$ci.lb, ci.ub=leave1$ci.ub,                slab=paste("Omitting ", leave1$slab, sep=""),atransf=exp,                at=log(c(0.15, 0.25, exp(pm$b),  1, 4)), xlim=log(c(0.01, 4.5)),                refline=pm$b               ) lines(x=log(c(1, 1)), y=c(0, 6))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: funnel(pm, main="Standard Error") regtest(pm) #>  #> Regression Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry #>  #> Model:     mixed-effects meta-regression model #> Predictor: standard error #>  #> Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry: z = -0.4407, p = 0.6594 #> Limit Estimate (as sei -> 0):   b = -0.1608 (CI: -2.1656, 1.8441)

title: second-outcomes
code: cdyn.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Cdyn" & time=="OLV"), method="PM") forest(cdyn.olv, header="Cdyn (OLV)", cex=1.5)

title: second-outcomes
text: Figure 3 paper different headings compared Figs 4 5.
code: plat.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Plat" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") forest(plat.tlv, header="Plateau (TLV)", cex=1.5) plat.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Plat" & time=="OLV"), method="PM") forest(plat.olv, header="Plateau (OLV)", cex=1.5)

title: second-outcomes
text: Fig 4 TLV first, Figs 3 5 OLV first.
code: peak.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Peak" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") forest(peak.tlv, header="Peak (TLV)", cex=1.5) peak.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Peak" & time=="OLV"), method="PM") forest(peak.olv, header="Peak (OLV)", cex=1.5)

title: second-outcomes
text: TLV OLV data mixed document (assuming Excel sheet correct)
code: po2.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="pO2" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") forest(po2.tlv, header="pO2 (TLV)", cex=1.5) # po2.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="pO2" & time=="OLV"), method="PM") # Error when using default options. Fix: po2.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = outcome1=="pO2" & time=="OLV", method="PM", control=list(tau2.max=1000)) forest(po2.olv, header="pO2 (OLV)", cex=1.5) est.ci <- function(mod){   est.with.ci <- paste(round(mod$b, 2), " (", round(mod$ci.lb, 2), ", ", round(mod$ci.ub, 2), ")", sep="")   est.with.ci } olv.results <- c(est.ci(cdyn.olv), est.ci(plat.olv), est.ci(peak.olv), est.ci(po2.olv)) tlv.results <- c("---", est.ci(plat.tlv), est.ci(peak.tlv), est.ci(po2.tlv))

title: Sensitivity analysis: leave one out
text: Data unclear: Multiple/range values given tidal volume PEEP values greater zero (dichotomisation zero) Li et al. results split two primary outcome, clear tidal volume etc. sets results.
